en: And I, brethren, could not speak unto you as unto spiritual, but as unto carnal, as unto babes in Christ.
hmr: Chun, unauhai, Thlarau mi kuoma hril angin in kuomah thu ka hril thei nawh a, tisa mihai kuoma hril angin ka hril lem kha; Kristaa nautêhai kuoma hril ang elin.

en: I fed you with milk, not with meat; for ye were not yet able to bear it: nay, not even now are ye able;
hmr: Bu ni loin, nênetuiin ka châwm cheu kha, bu in la fâk thei naw leiin; anih, tu khawm hin in la fâk thei naw rawp a nih, tisa mi in la ni rawp leiin.

en: for ye are yet carnal: for whereas there is among you jealousy and strife, are ye not carnal, and do ye not walk after the manner of men?
hmr: Nangni laia inthîkna le insêlna a um hlak leiin tisa mi la niin mihriem angin in la um zing a ni naw am a nih?

en: For when one saith, I am of Paul; and another, I am of Apollos; are ye not men?
hmr: Mi pakhatin, “Paula pâwl ka nih,” mi dangin, “kei chu Appolo pâwl ka nih,” in ti sûng chu mihriem in ni zing a ni naw am a ni?

en: What then is Apollos? and what is Paul? Ministers through whom ye believed; and each as the Lord gave to him.
hmr: Appolo chu ieng am a ni leh? Paula khawm chu ieng am a na? Rawngbâwltu nangni inawitirtu cheu chau an nih in sawnnaw; chu khawm chu Lalpain a ipêk ang ve ve chau a nih.

en: I planted, Apollos watered; but God gave the increase.
hmr: Keiin ka phun a, Appoloin tuiin a châwm a, nisienlakhawm, Pathienin ân ṭhangtir a nih.

en: So then neither is he that planteth anything, neither he that watereth; but God that giveth the increase.
hmr: Chuongchun, ân ṭhangtirtu Pathien chau naw chu a phuntu chu iengkhawm a ni nawh a, tuia châwm- tu khawm chu iengkhawm a ni nawh.

en: Now he that planteth and he that watereth are one: but each shall receive his own reward according to his own labor.
hmr: Chun, a phuntu le tuia châwmtu pumkhat an nih, nisienlakhawm, mâni sinthaw ang peiin lâwmman hmu ve vêng an tih.

en: For we are God’s fellow-workers: ye are God’s husbandry, God’s building.
hmr: Keini chu Pathien sinthaw- puituhai kan ni sih a, nangni Pathien lohma chu in na, Pathien in bâwl chu in ni bawk a nih.

en: According to the grace of God which was given unto me, as a wise masterbuilder I laid a foundation; and another buildeth thereon. But let each man take heed how he buildeth thereon.
hmr: Pathien lunginsietna ka kuoma pêka um ang peiin in bâwl hotu tak vartak angin keiin lungphûm ka rem a, mi dangin a chungah in an bâwl a, nisienlakhawm, mi tin a chunga bawl dingziea chun fimkhur seng raw hai se.

en: For other foundation can no man lay than that which is laid, which is Jesus Christ.
hmr: Lungphûm rem tasa naw chu tûkhawma lungphûm dang an rem thei si naw a, chu lungphûm chu Isu Krista chu a nih.

en: But if any man buildeth on the foundation gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay, stubble;
hmr: Chun, lungphûm chunga chun tûkhawmin rângkachakin amanih, tangkain amanih, lungmantamin amanih, thingin amanih, sâwlhnain amanih, bupâwlin amanih bâwl sienla, mi tin sinthaw chu inlang a tih;

en: each man’s work shall be made manifest: for the day shall declare it, because it is revealed in fire; and the fire itself shall prove each man’s work of what sort it is.
hmr: ni chun a suklang ding a ni sih a, meiin ân lâr ding a ni leiin, mei ngei chun mi tin sinthaw chu ieng ang am a ni fie tâng a tih.

en: If any man’s work shall abide which he built thereon, he shall receive a reward.
hmr: Tû sinthaw khawm a chunga a bâwl chu a um zing chun, ama chun lâwmman hmûng a tih.

en: If any man’s work shall be burned, he shall suffer loss: but he himself shall be saved; yet so as through fire.
hmr: Tû sinthaw khawm a kâng chun, ama chun chân a tih, ama tak ruok chu sandamin um a tih, nisienlakhawm, meia fe thleng ang elin.

en: Know ye not that ye are a temple of God, and that the Spirit of God dwelleth in you?
hmr: Pathien in in ni le Pathien Thlarau nangniah a um ti in hriet naw am a nih?

en: If any man destroyeth the temple of God, him shall God destroy; for the temple of God is holy, and such are ye.
hmr: Tûkhawmin Pathien in chu a sukkhawhlo chun Pathienin ama chu sukkhawhlo vêng a tih, Pathien in chu ân thieng sih a, chu in chu nangni in nih.

en: Let no man deceive himself. If any man thinketh that he is wise among you in this world, let him become a fool, that he may become wise.
hmr: Tûkhawmin ama le ama inhlêm naw raw se. Nangni laia tûkhawm hi khawvêla vara inngai chu a hung var theina dingin mi invêtah hung inchang phawt raw se.

en: For the wisdom of this world is foolishness with God. For it is written, He that taketh the wise in their craftiness:
hmr: Hi khawvêl varna hi Pathien ngaiah invêtna a ni sih a. “Ama chun mi varhai chu anni var vervêknaah a âwk hlak,” ti ziek a ni sih a.

en: and again, The Lord knoweth the reasonings of the wise, that they are vain.
hmr: “Lalpa chun mi varhai ngai- tuona chu a thlâwn a nih ti a hriet,” ti ziek a ni nâwk bawk a.

en: Wherefore let no one glory in men. For all things are yours;
hmr: Chuleiin, tûkhawmin mihriem- hai suong naw raw se.

en: whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas, or the world, or life, or death, or things present, or things to come; all are yours;
hmr: Iengkim hi in ta vawng a ni sih a: Paula amanih, Appolo amanih, Ki- pha amanih, khawvêl amanih, hring- na amanih, thina amanih, thil um tasahai amanih, a hung um dinghai le chun a rêngin in ta vawng a nih.

en: and ye are Christ’s; and Christ is God’s.
hmr: Nangni khawm Krista ta in na, Krista khawm chu Pathien ta a nih.
